description.narrative: The project development objective is to increase and sustain access of urban residents to basic infrastructure and services, particularly those living in deprived settlements.

condition.narrative: Carry a mid-term review of the project
The Government shall have designed a national framework for supporting city development.
The Recipient has adopted a revised Project Implementation Manual in form and substance satisfactory to the Association;
The Recipient has caused NIGETIP to recruit two additional engineers, each selected on the basis of terms of reference,qualification and experience satisfactory to the Association .
The Recipient has recruited staff, each selected on the basis of terms of reference, qualification and experience satisfactory tothe Association .
The Recipient shall assess improvement of the targeted institutions' capacities in procurement.

title.narrative: Number of people in urban areas provided with access to all-season roads within a 500 meter range under the project

comment.narrative: Baseline set to 0.00 during project restructuring.
Target revised at project restructuring.
Completion of works for the Niamey East-West road.

title.narrative: Additional number of pupils in school equipped with latrines in targeted areas

comment.narrative: Baseline: Niamey: 126,600; Maradi: 18,190
All works completed.

title.narrative: Additional number of market stands improved and park places created in truck terminals

comment.narrative: Maradi market: 0; Maradi truck terminal: 0; Dosso markets: 0; Dosso truck terminal: 0
Works reception awaited for the central market of Maradi, the two markets of Dosso and the trucks terminal of Dosso.

title.narrative: Effective management system established to operate markets and truck terminals upon rehabilitation / construction under the project.

comment.narrative: New indicator added at project restructuring.
System relating to the Maradi central market (1), the Dosso markets (2) and the Dosso trucks terminal (3).

No system yet in place. The study to set up a management system for the Maradi market at stage of provisional report. In themeantime, a provisional administration was put in place in June 2012. Arrangements for the two markets and the truck terminal ofDosso arebeing put in place.

title.narrative: Additional length of drains built/rehabilitated in targeted areas

comment.narrative: Part of drainage investments were dropped as part of project restructuring.
Targets revised at project restructuring.
All works completed

title.narrative: Number of people in urban areas provided with access to Improved Water Sources under the project

comment.narrative: baseline set to 0.00 during project restructuring.
All works completed but boreholes not yet connected to public network for water.

title.narrative: People with access to improved drainage in the areas served by the project

comment.narrative: Target revised at project restructuring.

title.narrative: Number of people in urban areas provided with access to Improved Sanitation under the project

comment.narrative: Target revised at project restructuring.

title.narrative: Length of drainage network actually maintained (km)

baseline.value: Niamey: 0.7 km; Maradi: 0.1 km; Dosso: 0.2 km

target.value: Niamey: 29 km; Maradi: 10 km; Dosso: 2 km

actual.value: Niamey: 108.3 km; Maradi: 2.0 km; Dosso: 0.5 km

comment.narrative: These numbers remain under discussion with the PIU. They need further confirmation.

title.narrative: Length of road network actually maintained (km)

baseline.value: Niamey: 1.5 km; Maradi: 0.5 km; Dosso: 0.2 km

target.value: Niamey: 66 km; Maradi: 37 km; Dosso: 11 km

actual.value: Niamey: 157.9 km; Maradi: 30.0 km; Dosso: 7.0 km

comment.narrative: These numbers remain under discussion with the PIU. They need further confirmation.

title.narrative: Annual budget actual expenditure on routine road and drainage maintenance within appropriate range (% of annual municipal income).

comment.narrative: Targets for 2011 to be considered against data provided i.e. Niamey: 7.22%; Maradi: 7.09%; Dosso: 9.55%.
Per data collected and consolidated by PIU for 2011 maintenance programs. Data for 2012 not available.

title.narrative: Annual budget allocation on routine road and drainage maintenance within defined range (% of annual municipal income).

comment.narrative: Per data collected and consolidated by PIU for 2012 maintenance programs. Positive variation against baseline as expected for2012,but slightly below municipal contracts targets.
Target revised at project restructuring.
All works completed.

title.narrative: Improved community water points constructed or rehabilitated under the project
